alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 7:56AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including coast and valley locations in San Diego County and the southern portion of the Santa Ana mountains in Orange County. * WHEN...Until 930 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water ponding on roads during the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Areas of minor flooding have been reported in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen over the past 2 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area in the next hour. Additional rounds of heavy rainfall are expected later this morning into the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Poway and Imperial Beach. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
